commit_message:
[k8s] Update cluster health status by native API

Calling Kubernetes native API to update the cluster health status
so that it can used for cluster auto healing.

Task: 24593
Story: 2002742

Change-Id: Ia76eeeb2f1734dff38d9660c804d7d2d0f65b9fb
(cherry picked from commit c38edc69297cc077411c89df5de31d9b84a125ee)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/02/638102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import strutils from magnum.objects import fields as m_fields def poll_health_status(self): k8s_api = k8s.create_k8s_api(self.context, self.cluster) status, reason = self._poll_health_status(k8s_api) self.data['health_status'] = status self.data['health_status_reason'] = reason def _poll_health_status(self, k8s_api): """Poll health status of API and nodes for given cluster Design Policy: 1. How to calculate the overall health status? Any node (including API and minion nodes) is not OK, then the overall health status is UNHEALTHY 2. The data structure of health_status_reason As an attribute of the cluster, the health_status_reason have to use the field type from oslo.versionedobjects/blob/master/oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py 3. How to get the health_status and health_status_reason? 3.1 Call /healthz to get the API health status 3.2 Call list_node (using API /api/v1/nodes) to get the nodes health status :param k8s_api: The api client to the cluster :return: Tumple including status and reason. Example: ( ClusterHealthStatus.HEALTHY, { 'api': 'ok', 'k8scluster-ydz7cfbxqqu3-node-0.Ready': False, 'k8scluster-ydz7cfbxqqu3-node-1.Ready': True, 'k8scluster-ydz7cfbxqqu3-node-2.Ready': True, } ) """ health_status = m_fields.ClusterHealthStatus.UNHEALTHY health_status_reason = {} api_status = None try: api_status, _, _ = k8s_api.api_client.call_api( '/healthz', 'GET', response_type=object) for node in k8s_api.list_node().items: node_key = node.metadata.name + ".Ready" ready = False for condition in node.status.conditions: if condition.type == 'Ready': ready = strutils.bool_from_string(condition.status) break health_status_reason[node_key] = ready if (api_status == 'ok' and all(n for n in health_status_reason.values())): health_status = m_fields.ClusterHealthStatus.HEALTHY health_status_reason['api'] = api_status except Exception as exp_api: if not api_status: api_status = (getattr(exp_api, 'body', None) or getattr(exp_api, 'message', None)) health_status_reason['api'] = api_status return health_status, health_status_reason

commit_message:
Make Grafana and Prometheus cluster accessible only

Currently, Magnum can support master LB without floating IP. So
it would be to drop the nodeport for Prometheus and Grafana so
that user can access them with cluster IP and kubectl proxy.

Task: 22587
Story: 2002737

Change-Id: I9396bbbe98ff5bc17b34c68228f5ec7111f65fc0

commit_message:
Remove Docker when upgrading to Podman

When upgrading to Podman, we'll purge Docker resources with the prune
command. Then we'll stop Docker and remove the package.
Then remove /var/lib/docker.
It'll happen in post_upgrade_tasks.

blueprint podman-support
Change-Id: Idac992510a29e89ffa9d252e3c8f9fa89175b18a

added_lines: ContainerCli: type: string default: 'docker' description: CLI tool used to manage containers. constraints: - allowed_values: ['docker', 'podman'] UndercloudUpgrade: type: boolean description: Flag to indicate undercloud upgrade process is being run. default: false post_upgrade_tasks: - name: Prune everything in Docker docker_prune: containers: yes images: yes networks: yes volumes: yes builder_cache: yes when: - container_cli == "podman" - step|int == 4

commit_message:
fix unit tests

With the introduction of [1] into neutron, the revision number of a
created router is now 1 and not 0. The dragonflow code is expecting 0
today and thus 3 unit tests fail due to this.

This patch updates to the tests to expect the revision number to be 1
rather than 0 as per [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635671/

Change-Id: I8d16fada6972854719d9023dd79915820a73ff3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/27/639727/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertEqual(1, router['revision_number'])

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-01 17:44:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/tasks/test_live_migrate.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ecdf3c67ee464139d8a6f9cb8d332857f261228b', 'message': 'fix up numa-topology live migration hypervisor check

It turns out that even when KVM is supported by qemu the libvirt
driver will report the hypervisor type as "QEMU".  So we need to
fix up the hypervisor type check in the live migration code that
checks whether the instance has a NUMA topology.

Closes-Bug: #1818092
Change-Id: I5127227a1e3d76dd413a820b048547ba578aff6b
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4da058723332a58323640fabce3d95902946a07d)
'}]
commit_message:
fix up numa-topology live migration hypervisor check

It turns out that even when KVM is supported by qemu the libvirt
driver will report the hypervisor type as "QEMU".  So we need to
fix up the hypervisor type check in the live migration code that
checks whether the instance has a NUMA topology.

Closes-Bug: #1818092
Change-Id: I5127227a1e3d76dd413a820b048547ba578aff6b
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4da058723332a58323640fabce3d95902946a07d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/62/640462/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: uuid=uuids.cn1, hypervisor_type='QEMU')

commit_message:
DVR edge router: avoid accidental centralized floating IP remove

Need to pass centralized floating IPs as preserve_ips to
_external_gateway_added during DVR router update.
Otherwise IP addresses will be deleted from gw device in certain case.
The case is when a router with active centralized floating IPs is
being scheduled to a new dvr_snat L3 agent (rescheduled from a down one).
Please see corresponding traces in the bug description.

Change-Id: Iaeb9fbed73144df6fcd9092c665ed19986e85f4d
Closes-bug: #1817306
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/48/638648/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.common import utils as common_utils def _list_centralized_floating_ip_cidrs(self): # Compute a list of addresses this gw is supposed to have. # This avoids unnecessarily removing those addresses and # causing a momentarily network outage. floating_ips = self.get_floating_ips() return [common_utils.ip_to_cidr(ip['floating_ip_address']) for ip in floating_ips if ip.get(n_const.DVR_SNAT_BOUND)] preserve_ips = self._list_centralized_floating_ip_cidrs() preserve_ips)

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2018-07-27 14:59:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f2edd93059c59ed068ca9ef185fc42356248f6e4', 'message': "WIP Placement reporting service plugin

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling. Even if you load the service plugin the logic gracefully
degrades for heartbeat messages not containing resource provider info.

If needed the sync can be forced in multiple ways. First, if you restart
an agent then the RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. You may
also delete the agent by 'openstack network agent delete' and let the
next heartbeat message re-create the agent object. On re-creation the
RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. On the other hand a
neutron-server restart does not trigger a re-sync in any way. Depending
on the trade-off between the admin's needs to force re-syncs and the
performance of (not absolutely necessary) Placement updates re-sync
conditions may be further fine tuned.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = neutron.services.placement_report.plugin.\
                  PlacementReportPlugin

TODO break up this change to multiple files and changes
TODO more tests

Change-Id: Ia1ff6f7559ab77913ddb9c3b134420a401b8eb43
Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>

"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2018-09-26 12:07:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/00558cf7fe23049127a2ee4a7c2e5279a7206269', 'message': "WIP Placement reporting service plugin

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling. Even if you load the service plugin the logic gracefully
degrades for heartbeat messages not containing resource provider info.

If needed the sync can be forced in multiple ways. First, if you restart
an agent then the RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. You may
also delete the agent by 'openstack network agent delete' and let the
next heartbeat message re-create the agent object. On re-creation the
RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. On the other hand a
neutron-server restart does not trigger a re-sync in any way. Depending
on the trade-off between the admin's needs to force re-syncs and the
performance of (not absolutely necessary) Placement updates re-sync
conditions may be further fine tuned.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = neutron.services.placement_report.plugin.\
                  PlacementReportPlugin

TODO break up this change to multiple files and changes

"}, {'number': 20, 'created': '2019-01-23 16:11:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8e8df2d8a1565297a98a87c85d88b1e865bcd8df', 'message': "Placement reporting service plugin

This service plugin synchronizes ML2 mechanism driver agents' resource
information to Placement. To use this service an agent must add
'resource_provider_bandwidths' to the 'configurations' field of its
RPC heartbeat. It also may add 'resource_provider_inventory_defaults'
to fine tune Placement inventory parameters. Again to use this service a
mechanism driver must implement get_standrd_device_mappings() and allocate
a UUID as mechanism driver property 'resource_provider_uuid5_namespace'.

The synchronization is triggered by:
* any new agent object in the DB
* restart of an agent (via 'start_flag' in the RPC heartbeat)
* if an agent's 'resources_synced' attribute is not True (None/False)

The latter should autoheal transient errors of the synchronization
process. That is if a sync attemp fails then we store
resources_synced=False which triggers a sync retry at each new heartbeat
message until a sync attempt finally succeeds and we can set
resources_synced=True.

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling. Even if you load the service plugin the logic gracefully
degrades for heartbeat messages not containing resource provider info.

If needed the sync can be forced in multiple ways. First, if you restart
an agent then the RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. You may
also delete the agent by 'openstack network agent delete' and let the
next heartbeat message re-create the agent object. On re-creation the
RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. On the other hand a
neutron-server restart does not trigger a re-sync in any way. Depending
on the trade-off between the admin's needs to force re-syncs and the
performance of (not absolutely necessary) Placement updates re-sync
conditions may be further fine tuned.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = placement

Change-Id: Ia1ff6f7559ab77913ddb9c3b134420a401b8eb43
Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/586567
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)
"}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2019-01-30 13:37:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3eb32cb57e5914e7322223580dd14a379ede10be', 'message': "Placement reporting service plugin

"}, {'number': 24, 'created': '2019-02-15 09:49:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/526439fc8dd18e5489731c73ecdee6c1e0addd37', 'message': "Placement reporting service plugin

This service plugin synchronizes ML2 mechanism driver agents' resource
information to Placement. To use this service an agent must add
'resource_provider_bandwidths' to the 'configurations' field of its
RPC heartbeat. It also may add 'resource_provider_inventory_defaults'
to fine tune Placement inventory parameters. Again to use this service a
mechanism driver must implement get_standrd_device_mappings() and allocate
a UUID as mechanism driver property 'resource_provider_uuid5_namespace'.

The synchronization is triggered by:
* any new agent object in the DB
* restart of an agent (via 'start_flag' in the RPC heartbeat)
* if an agent's 'resources_synced' attribute is not True (None/False)

The latter should autoheal transient errors of the synchronization
process. That is if a sync attemp fails then we store
resources_synced=False which triggers a sync retry at each new heartbeat
message until a sync attempt finally succeeds and we can set
resources_synced=True.

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling. Even if you load the service plugin the logic gracefully
degrades for heartbeat messages not containing resource provider info.

If needed the sync can be forced in multiple ways. First, if you restart
an agent then the RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. You may
also delete the agent by 'openstack network agent delete' and let the
next heartbeat message re-create the agent object. On re-creation the
RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. On the other hand a
neutron-server restart does not trigger a re-sync in any way. Depending
on the trade-off between the admin's needs to force re-syncs and the
performance of (not absolutely necessary) Placement updates re-sync
conditions may be further fine tuned.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = placement

Change-Id: Ia1ff6f7559ab77913ddb9c3b134420a401b8eb43
Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/586567
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Placement reporting service plugin

This service plugin synchronizes ML2 mechanism driver agents' resource
information to Placement. To use this service an agent must add
'resource_provider_bandwidths' to the 'configurations' field of its
RPC heartbeat. It also may add 'resource_provider_inventory_defaults'
to fine tune Placement inventory parameters. Again to use this service a
mechanism driver must implement get_standrd_device_mappings() and allocate
a UUID as mechanism driver property 'resource_provider_uuid5_namespace'.

The synchronization is triggered by:
* any new agent object in the DB
* restart of an agent (via 'start_flag' in the RPC heartbeat)
* if an agent's 'resources_synced' attribute is not True (None/False)

The latter should autoheal transient errors of the synchronization
process. That is if a sync attemp fails then we store
resources_synced=False which triggers a sync retry at each new heartbeat
message until a sync attempt finally succeeds and we can set
resources_synced=True.

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling. Even if you load the service plugin the logic gracefully
degrades for heartbeat messages not containing resource provider info.

If needed the sync can be forced in multiple ways. First, if you restart
an agent then the RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. You may
also delete the agent by 'openstack network agent delete' and let the
next heartbeat message re-create the agent object. On re-creation the
RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. On the other hand a
neutron-server restart does not trigger a re-sync in any way. Depending
on the trade-off between the admin's needs to force re-syncs and the
performance of (not absolutely necessary) Placement updates re-sync
conditions may be further fine tuned.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = placement

Change-Id: Ia1ff6f7559ab77913ddb9c3b134420a401b8eb43
Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/586567
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Remove TypeError handling for get_info

This was only put in to handle out of tree drivers in backports to
stable branches; kill it in master.

Change-Id: I73d90d11577fb5a2ef5363c8168970f7bbeda6ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/43/640043/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: db_instance, orig_db_power_state): vm_instance = self.driver.get_info(db_instance, vm_power_state = vm_instance.state context, vm_state, db_instance, orig_db_power_state)
deleted_lines: db_instance, orig_db_power_state, vm_power_state): # TODO(jroll) remove the check for TypeError here; # it's only here to be able to backport this without # breaking out-of-tree drivers. try: vm_instance = self.driver.get_info(db_instance, vm_power_state = vm_instance.state except TypeError: pass context, vm_state, db_instance, orig_db_power_state, vm_power_state)

commit_message:
ironic: check fresh data when sync_power_state doesn't line up

We return cached data to sync_power_state to avoid pummeling the ironic
API. However, this can lead to a race condition where an instance is
powered on, but nova thinks it should be off and calls stop(). Check
again without the cache when this happens to make sure we don't
unnecessarily kill an instance.

Closes-Bug: #1815791
Change-Id: I907b69eb689cf6c169a4869cfc7889308ca419d5

Calling the " "stop API. Current vm_state: %(vm_state)s, " "current task_state: %(task_state)s, " "original DB power_state: %(db_power_state)s, " "current VM power_state: %(vm_power_state)s", {'vm_state': vm_state, 'task_state': db_instance.task_state, 'db_power_state': orig_db_power_state, 'vm_power_state': vm_power_state}, instance=db_instance) try: # Note(maoy): here we call the API instead of # brutally updating the vm_state in the database # to allow all the hooks and checks to be performed. if db_instance.shutdown_terminate: self.compute_api.delete(context, db_instance) else: self.compute_api.stop(context, db_instance) except Exception: # Note(maoy): there is no need to propagate the error # because the same power_state will be retrieved next # time and retried. # For example, there might be another task scheduled. LOG.exception("error during stop() in " "sync_power_state.", instance=db_instance)

subject: Restart all L3 agents in test that check no packet loss in HA routers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-01 13:45:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/fullstack/base.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_l3_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bdd35405548c1d60072cd71ef648a724bf1d31d2', 'message': 'Restart all L3 agents in test that check no packet loss in HA routers

In fullstack test
test_l3_agent.test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost
restarts of L3 agents where done in 2 steps:
1. restart of all standby agents,
2. restart of all active agents.

It was done like that because of bug [1] and [2].
Now when those bugs are fixed, lets change this test to
some "more probable" scenario. So agents will be restarted
without checking which one is master and which is standby.
However agents will be restarted one by one instead of doing
restarts in (almost) exactly same time.

Restarting all agents in same time caused still some issue
on my local testing environment but I suspect that it might be
some problem related to the nature of fullstack tests and to the
fact that 2 different "nodes" are in fact simulated by namespaces only.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1776459
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1798475

Change-Id: I731211b56a57d44636e741009721522f67c12368
'}]
commit_message:
Restart all L3 agents in test that check no packet loss in HA routers

In fullstack test
test_l3_agent.test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost
restarts of L3 agents where done in 2 steps:
1. restart of all standby agents,
2. restart of all active agents.

It was done like that because of bug [1] and [2].
Now when those bugs are fixed, lets change this test to
some "more probable" scenario. So agents will be restarted
without checking which one is master and which is standby.
However agents will be restarted one by one instead of doing
restarts in (almost) exactly same time.

Restarting all agents in same time caused still some issue
on my local testing environment but I suspect that it might be
some problem related to the nature of fullstack tests and to the
fact that 2 different "nodes" are in fact simulated by namespaces only.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1776459
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1798475

Change-Id: I731211b56a57d44636e741009721522f67c12368

commit_message:
Add oslo.privsep to config-generator list

We recently exposed the privsep opts for config generator use, so
projects that depend on oslo.privsep should include them in their
sample configs.

Change-Id: I7fab7002d51b2aaf1b0a6545d07b616120e26461

We're running a fair number of scenario tests
that we don't need to be here.  Just grab the
ones that are interesting for Cinder.

commit_message:
Replace hiera lookup for ceph::profile::params::fsid

We do not deploy Ceph via puppet-ceph so we need to pass to
cinder-volume the RBD secret UUID explicitly

Implements: blueprint remove-puppet-ceph
Change-Id: I8b22917e7436084028ef4fbe7604d28d6a68bee0

commit_message:
Fix for auth version change in Brcd HTTP

On FOS 8.1.0b and greater firmwares, the authentication
for HTTP sessions has changed.  Add check to get
the auth version, then authenticate with identifier
rather than randomno when authversion is not 1.

Also, the formatting of nsinfo.htm has changed,
so now using the formatted nsinfo.html page
to gather nport wwns from the name server.

Change-Id: Ia2773f930513a5c8914e40805291d015a2ecb130
Closes-Bug: #1810327
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/97/637297/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.auth_version = '' # Get the auth version for 8.1.0b+ switches self.auth_version = self.get_nvp_value(parsed_data, zone_constant.AUTHVERSION) if (self.auth_version == "1"): # Extract the random no from secinfo.html response self.random_no = self.get_nvp_value(parsed_data, zone_constant.RANDOM) # Form the authentication string auth_string = '%s:%s:%s' % (self.switch_user, self.switch_pwd, self.random_no) else: auth_string = '%s:%s' % (self.switch_user, self.switch_pwd) if (self.auth_version == "3"): auth_id = self.get_nvp_value(parsed_data, zone_constant.IDENTIFIER) auth_string = '%s:xxx:%s' % (self.switch_user, auth_id) else: # Replace password in the authentication string with xxx auth_string = '%s:xxx:%s' % (self.switch_user, self.random_no) for line in response.splitlines(): if line.startswith(zone_constant.NS_DELIM): nsinfo.append(line.split('=')[-1])
deleted_lines: # Extract the random no from secinfo.html response self.random_no = self.get_nvp_value(parsed_data, zone_constant.RANDOM) # Form the authentication string auth_string = (self.switch_user + ":" + self.switch_pwd + ":" + self.random_no) # Replace password in the authentication string with xxx auth_string = (self.switch_user + ":" + "xxx" + ":" + self.random_no) parsed_raw_zoneinfo = self.get_parsed_data( response, zone_constant.NSINFO_BEGIN, zone_constant.NSINFO_END).strip("\t\n\r") # build the name server information in the correct format for line in parsed_raw_zoneinfo.splitlines(): start_index = line.find(zone_constant.NS_DELIM) + 7 if start_index != -1: nsinfo.extend([line[start_index:start_index + 23].strip()])

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import. This patch switches rpc uses over to

This also addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a

commit_message:
Fix gate issues on master

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import. This patch switches rpc uses over to
neutron-lib.

This also addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a
non-empty __pycache__ directory. This adjusts the options passed to
find so that it is tolerant of this scenario and allows tox runs to
proceed.

"rm -rf .tox/lower-constraints/*" in testenv command in tox.ini
is unnecessary, so it is dropped too.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Change-Id: I95490cba503d3f3a61bdc28ef63edc82a3ae1be3
(cherry picked from commit 36ca752e80d21b4490d5dfb13f16b351ff6ff34f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/17/640617/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: find . -path "*/__pycache__*" -delete

commit_message:
Add support for binding activate and deactivate

Add support for binding activate and deactivate callbacks
in SR-IOV mechanism driver agent.

this work item is required for supporting VM live-migration
with SR-IOV in nova with libvirt as hypervisor.

This commits implemets the following:
- Implement binding_activate() and binding_deactivate() methods in agent.
- Configure agent to listen on the relevant topics.
- RPC version bump on agend side.
- When processing an activated binding treat it as a newly added port.
- Deactivated binding will trigger a NO-OP as once a binding is
  deactivated it will be removed by Hypervisor.

Closes-Bug: #1815361

Change-Id: I6b7195e08ed8932cfc2785b66627de2854ead85d

commit_message:
Add "links" in the response of "nova show" for a down-cell instance

The down-cell microversion 2.69 just recently merged and it returns
links in the response for GET /servers/detail and GET /servers but not
for GET /servers/{server_id} which was an oversight because that API
returns links normally.

We should include the links key in the 'nova show' case as well and this
patch does exactly that.

Typically this would require a microversion change but given the code
merged recently and is not yet released we are just fixing this
oversight through this patch without a microversion bump.

Closes-Bug: #1818131
Change-Id: I2ce03df994f59c37b5ce3102c4e7165d17701798

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import. This patch switches rpc uses over to
neutron-lib.

This also addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a
non-empty __pycache__ directory. This adjusts the options passed to
find so that it is tolerant of this scenario and allows tox runs to
proceed.

"rm -rf .tox/lower-constraints/*" in testenv command in tox.ini
is unnecessary, so it is dropped too.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Change-Id: I95490cba503d3f3a61bdc28ef63edc82a3ae1be3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix gate issues on master

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import. This patch switches rpc uses over to
neutron-lib.

This also addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a
non-empty __pycache__ directory. This adjusts the options passed to
find so that it is tolerant of this scenario and allows tox runs to
proceed.

"rm -rf .tox/lower-constraints/*" in testenv command in tox.ini
is unnecessary, so it is dropped too.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Change-Id: I95490cba503d3f3a61bdc28ef63edc82a3ae1be3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/19/637619/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: find . -type d -name "__pycache__" -exec rm -rf {} \;

commit_message:
Tests: Fix up migrate notify tests

Search for notify calls in a way that ignores extra
notifications.

Remove mock_notify.assert_not_called()

Partial-Bug: #1803648

commit_message:
Cleanup DVR SNAT port list creation code

port_list is already an empty list if no SNAT ports were found,
no reason to re-initialize or print it.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I0589266646dfa0bc42ef6b7e6929f4dc2237f2b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/94/636994/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.info('SNAT interface port list does not exist, creating one')
deleted_lines: port_list = [] LOG.info('SNAT interface port list does not exist,' ' so create one: %s', port_list)

commit_message:
Class to represent Placement state and sync

Represent the desired state of the Placement DB and provide a method to
sync this state to Placement. This is unused as is. A later patch in
the same series is going to use it. But it is broken out into its own
file and patch, so the code is organized better and easier to review.

Change-Id: I3728117f90b7fad2423c2a4276db214ec86c9d8e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/570847
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/577220
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/616194
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import uuid import mock from neutron.services.placement_report import state_sync from neutron.tests import base class DeferredCallTestCase(base.BaseTestCase): def test_defer(self): fun = mock.Mock() state_sync.DeferredCall(fun) fun.assert_not_called() def test_execute(self): fun = mock.Mock() deferred = state_sync.DeferredCall(fun, 'some arg', kwarg='some kwarg') deferred.execute() fun.assert_called_once_with('some arg', kwarg='some kwarg') class PlacementStateTestCase(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(PlacementStateTestCase, self).setUp() self.client_mock = mock.Mock() self.driver_uuid_namespace = uuid.UUID( '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001') self.agent_host_rp_uuid = uuid.UUID( '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002') self.kwargs = { 'rp_bandwidths': {}, 'rp_inventory_defaults': {}, 'driver_uuid_namespace': self.driver_uuid_namespace, 'agent_type': 'fake agent type', 'agent_host': 'fakehost', 'agent_host_rp_uuid': self.agent_host_rp_uuid, 'device_mappings': {}, 'supported_vnic_types': [], 'client': self.client_mock, } def test__update_physnet_traits(self): self.kwargs.update({ 'device_mappings': { 'physnet0': ['eth0'], 'physnet1': ['eth1'], }, 'rp_bandwidths': { 'eth0': {'egress': 1, 'ingress': 1}, }, }) state = state_sync.PlacementState(**self.kwargs) for deferred in state._update_physnet_traits(): deferred.execute() self.client_mock.update_trait.assert_called_with( name='CUSTOM_PHYSNET_PHYSNET0') def test__update_vnic_type_traits(self): self.kwargs.update({ 'supported_vnic_types': ['direct'], }) state = state_sync.PlacementState(**self.kwargs) for deferred in state._update_vnic_type_traits(): deferred.execute() self.client_mock.update_trait.assert_any_call( name='CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT') def test__create_agent_rp(self): state = state_sync.PlacementState(**self.kwargs) deferred = state._create_agent_rp() deferred.execute() self.client_mock.ensure_resource_provider.assert_called_with( resource_provider={ 'name': 'fakehost:fake agent type', # uuid -v5 '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001' 'fakehost' 'uuid': uuid.UUID('c0b4abe5-516f-54b8-b965-ff94060dcbcc'), 'parent_provider_uuid': self.agent_host_rp_uuid}) def test_create_resource_providers(self): self.kwargs.update({ 'rp_bandwidths': { 'eth0': {'egress': 1, 'ingress': 1}, }, }) state = state_sync.PlacementState(**self.kwargs) for deferred in state.create_resource_providers(): deferred.execute() self.client_mock.ensure_resource_provider.assert_called_with( resource_provider={ 'name': 'fakehost:fake agent type:eth0', # uuid -v5 '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001' # 'fakehost:eth0' 'uuid': uuid.UUID('1ea6f823-bcf2-5dc5-9bee-4ee6177a6451'), # uuid -v5 '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001' 'fakehost' 'parent_provider_uuid': uuid.UUID( 'c0b4abe5-516f-54b8-b965-ff94060dcbcc')}) def test_update_resource_provider_traits(self): self.kwargs.update({ 'device_mappings': { 'physnet0': ['eth0'], }, 'rp_bandwidths': { 'eth0': {'egress': 1, 'ingress': 1}, }, 'supported_vnic_types': ['normal'], }) state = state_sync.PlacementState(**self.kwargs) for deferred in state.update_resource_provider_traits(): deferred.execute() self.client_mock.update_resource_provider_traits.assert_called() self.assertEqual( # uuid -v5 '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001' 'fakehost:eth0' uuid.UUID('1ea6f823-bcf2-5dc5-9bee-4ee6177a6451'), self.client_mock.update_resource_provider_traits.call_args[1][ 'resource_provider_uuid']) # NOTE(bence romsics): To avoid testing the _order_ of traits. self.assertEqual( set(['CUSTOM_PHYSNET_PHYSNET0', 'CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_NORMAL']), set(self.client_mock.update_resource_provider_traits.call_args[1][ 'traits'])) def test_update_resource_provider_inventories(self): self.kwargs.update({ 'device_mappings': { 'physnet0': ['eth0'], }, 'rp_bandwidths': { 'eth0': {'egress': 100, 'ingress': None}, }, 'rp_inventory_defaults': { 'step_size': 10, 'max_unit': 50, }, }) state = state_sync.PlacementState(**self.kwargs) for deferred in state.update_resource_provider_inventories(): deferred.execute() self.client_mock.\ update_resource_provider_inventories.assert_called_with( # uuid -v5 '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001' \ # 'fakehost:eth0' resource_provider_uuid=uuid.UUID( '1ea6f823-bcf2-5dc5-9bee-4ee6177a6451'), inventories={ 'NET_BANDWIDTH_EGRESS_KILOBITS_PER_SECOND': { 'total': 100, 'step_size': 10, 'max_unit': 50}})

subject: Fix modules import order
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-28 14:18:56.000000000', 'files': ['trove/cmd/taskmanager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/75784f94b1411a325ab3bdff4c71d2e5aa2abc2b', 'message': 'Fix modules import order

Change fixes placement of single module import. Previous import
placement prevented configuration options from being loaded in
correct order in relation to other modules. As a result modules
using configuration on Trove service startup did not see modified
configuration and behave in unexpected way.

Change-Id: I22edfcb80ecb597826cd01f0aad448cfa169b422
'}]
commit_message:
Fix modules import order

Change fixes placement of single module import. Previous import
placement prevented configuration options from being loaded in
correct order in relation to other modules. As a result modules
using configuration on Trove service startup did not see modified
configuration and behave in unexpected way.

Change-Id: I22edfcb80ecb597826cd01f0aad448cfa169b422

deleted_lines: from trove.taskmanager import api as task_api

commit_message:
Make resource class required

Allocation API requires a resource class, so we have to require it now.

Change-Id: Ic3729fb8aa02c82379eceb2a2555fc9c0ba9bc57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/metalsmith refs/changes/85/640385/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: requested node's resource class. Mandatory.

subject: Enable adoption of subnets into a subnet pool
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 23:26:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1c1087e4ac678372f70b34f5b299baa9a50a61bc', 'message': 'Enable adoption of subnets into a subnet pool

This patch enables the adoption of existing subnets into a
subnetpool. Adoption of a subnet is done by passing the ID
of the hosting network and the address family (ip_version)
which causes all subnets in the specified address family
on the given network to be adopted by the subnet pool. This
continues to work within the constraints on subnet pool
membership of subnets on the same network. This also ensures
prefix uniqueness across an address scope before comitting the
adoption of subnets.

Change-Id: I5d3c07beb7f109142d2e3633e69f86ca39edc450
Implements: blueprint subnetpool-adoption

'}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2017-07-03 16:00:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/99c868bfb7006fe0638e2ee6c476c5a06f77f592', 'message': 'Enable adoption of subnets into a subnet pool

This patch enables the adoption of existing subnets into a
subnetpool. Adoption of a subnet is done by passing the ID
of the hosting network and the address family (ip_version)
which causes all subnets in the specified address family
on the given network to be adopted by the subnet pool. This
continues to work within the constraints on subnet pool
membership of subnets on the same network. This also ensures
prefix uniqueness across an address scope before comitting the
adoption of subnets.

Change-Id: I5d3c07beb7f109142d2e3633e69f86ca39edc450
Partially-Implements: blueprint subnet-onboard
Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>
Co-Authored-By: Trevor McCasland <TM2086@att.com>

This patch enables the adoption of existing subnets into a
subnetpool. Adoption of a subnet is done by passing the ID
of the hosting network and the address family (ip_version)
which causes all subnets in the specified address family
on the given network to be adopted by the subnet pool. This
continues to work within the constraints on subnet pool
membership of subnets on the same network. This also ensures
prefix uniqueness across an address scope before comitting the
adoption of subnets.

Change-Id: I5d3c07beb7f109142d2e3633e69f86ca39edc450
Partially-Implements: blueprint subnet-onboard
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <rtidwell@suse.com>
Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>
Co-Authored-By: Trevor McCasland <TM2086@att.com>

commit_message:
Enable adoption of subnets into a subnet pool

This patch enables the adoption of existing subnets into a
subnetpool. Adoption of a subnet is done by passing the ID
of the hosting network and the address family (ip_version)
which causes all subnets in the specified address family
on the given network to be adopted by the subnet pool. This
continues to work within the constraints on subnet pool
membership of subnets on the same network. This also ensures
prefix uniqueness across an address scope before comitting the
adoption of subnets.

Change-Id: I5d3c07beb7f109142d2e3633e69f86ca39edc450
Partially-Implements: blueprint subnet-onboard
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <rtidwell@suse.com>
Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>
Co-Authored-By: Trevor McCasland <TM2086@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bernard Caffarelli <bcafarel@redhat.com>

added_lines: "default-subnetpools", "subnetpool_adoption"]

commit_message:
Document the wonders of scale testing nova with the fake driver

Devstack has some little known variables for running nova
with the fake compute driver and running several nova-compute
services on a single host, which can be useful for testing
move operations and scale testing of controller services like
nova-api and nova-scheduler.

This adds documentation about the fake virt driver and related
variables and scaling considerations when using them.

Change-Id: Ic89d463d0f3f180b323edd6e2c8ff0404638ef07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/05/640205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Fake virt driver ================ Nova has a `fake virt driver`_ which can be used for scale testing the control plane services or testing "move" operations between fake compute nodes, for example cold/live migration, evacuate and unshelve. The fake virt driver does not communicate with any hypervisor, it just reports some fake resource inventory values and keeps track of the state of the "guests" created, moved and deleted. It is not feature-complete with the compute API but is good enough for most API testing, and is also used within the nova functional tests themselves so is fairly robust. .. _fake virt driver: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/virt/fake.py Configuration ------------- Set the following in your devstack ``local.conf``: .. code-block:: ini [[local|localrc]] VIRT_DRIVER=fake NUMBER_FAKE_NOVA_COMPUTE=<number> The ``NUMBER_FAKE_NOVA_COMPUTE`` variable controls the number of fake ``nova-compute`` services to run and defaults to 1. When ``VIRT_DRIVER=fake`` is used, devstack will disable quota checking in nova and neutron automatically. However, other services, like cinder, will still enforce quota limits by default. Scaling ------- The actual value to use for ``NUMBER_FAKE_NOVA_COMPUTE`` depends on factors such as: * The size of the host (physical or virtualized) on which devstack is running. * The number of API workers. By default, devstack will run ``max($nproc/2, 2)`` workers per API service. If you are running several fake compute services on a single host, then consider setting ``API_WORKERS=1`` in ``local.conf``. In addition, while quota will be disabled in neutron, there is no fake ML2 backend for neutron so creating fake VMs will still result in real ports being created. To create servers without networking, you can specify ``--nic=none`` when creating the server, for example: .. code-block:: shell $ openstack --os-compute-api-version 2.37 server create --flavor cirros256 \ --image cirros-0.3.5-x86_64-disk --nic none --wait test-server .. note:: ``--os-compute-api-version`` greater than or equal to 2.37 is required to use ``--nic=none``. To avoid overhead from other services which you may not need, disable them in your ``local.conf``, for example: .. code-block:: ini disable_service horizon disable_service tempest

subject: Record requester in the InstancePCIRequest
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-14 16:53:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fd79231824ceed48335378e8c52a75066bb5b864', 'message': "Record requester in the InstancePCIRequest

An InstancePCIRequest might represents the VF device request of a
neutron port that has bandwidth request as well. In this case nova
needs to correlate the pci request with the port's resource request to
make sure the bandwidth and the VF are allocated from the same PF.

This patch introduces the new ``requester_id`` field to the
InstancePCIRequest ovo and stores the port_id in that field if the
pci request is created from a neturon port. For completeness if the
pci request is created from a flavor then the flavor_id will be stored
there.

The value of the ``requester_id`` field will be used in a subsequent
patch.

TODO:
 * add unit test coverage

Change-Id: I73786b7900957faca72d6ddfd01023a4b186e14d
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

commit_message:
Record requester in the InstancePCIRequest

An InstancePCIRequest might represent the VF device request of a
neutron port that has bandwidth request as well. In this case nova
needs to correlate the pci request with the port's resource request to
make sure the bandwidth and the VF are allocated from the same PF.

This patch introduces the new ``requester_id`` field to the
InstancePCIRequest ovo and stores the port_id in that field if the
pci request is created from a neutron port.

The value of the ``requester_id`` field will be used in a subsequent
patch to match it against the existing RequestGroup.requester_id.

Change-Id: I73786b7900957faca72d6ddfd01023a4b186e14d
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

deleted_lines: VERSION = '1.2' request_id=request['request_id']) 'request_id': x.request_id} for x in self.requests]

commit_message:
Pylint: Filter out cinder.objects and requests E1101

Use generated-members to filter out false positives.

Unfortunately, generated-members doesn't really work
right, but this is close enough for now.

Change-Id: I184c3c98a90428dbb033da42d8938e8af9866b78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/82/638482/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This is for cinder.objects.*, and requests.packages.*, but due to # https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/2498 # it doesn't seem that generated-members can be specified correctly. # Clean this up later when pylint works correctly. generated-members=objects,requests

revisions:

If ovs-agent is restarting, the added port list and
updated list will be the same. So here we just set
the current map to the processed results to prevent
re-process these ports again.

Related-Bug: #1813703

Change-Id: I1804e534beff88671920028a13c590161137d0e1
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent re-process the ports again during restart

If ovs-agent is restarting, the added port list and
updated list will be the same. So here we just set
the current map to the processed results to prevent
re-process these ports again.

Related-Bug: #1813703

Change-Id: I1804e534beff88671920028a13c590161137d0e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/43/638643/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.iter_num == 0 and ovs_restarted: # This is someting eelated to function # update_stale_ofport_rules. # If ovs-agent is restarting, the added port list and # updated list will be the same. So here we just set # the current vifname_to_ofport_map to the processed # results to prevent re-process these ports again. current = self.int_br.get_vif_port_to_ofport_map() self.vifname_to_ofport_map = current

commit_message:
Adds the server group info into show server detail API.

The server-groups UUID add to response of 'GET /servers/{id}',
'PUT /servers/{server_id}" and rebuild API
'POST /servers/{server_id}/action'.

Change-Id: I4a2a584df56ece7beb8b12c0ce9b0e6b30237120
Implements: blueprint show-server-group
Co-authored-by: Gerry Kopec <Gerry.Kopec@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>

commit_message:
Replace cp -l with --reflink=auto

Hardlinking in cp has special file permission requirements that can
make it fail.

Using --reflink=auto is much safer and does not have
the same requirements, while preserving its advantages.

This allows us to undo the unsecure chmod done on src dir
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625576/

Change-Id: I51e73f5880206f9ce8cdd85584d80ca7103fd965
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/98/628998/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: find $cache_dir -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -exec cp --reflink=auto {} $DEST/devstack/files/ \;

subject: Fix race in test_volume_swap_server_with_error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-01-31 22:39:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d4a0e470fe9987950bc84ae2f658232bde8d95c7', 'message': 'Fix race in test_volume_swap_server_with_error

Change I03c8e8225e51fd80580772752c0b292987e34218 added
another notification to the list checked in
test_volume_swap_server_with_error and then change
Id587967ea4f9980c292492e2f659bf55fb037b28 relied on
checking the last notification in the list (compute.exception)
but per the note in the test, that last exception can
race to show up by the time we check the size of the
notification list which can result in an IndexError.

This change updates the note about the size of the list
and also adds a wait loop for the last notification to show
up before we check it.

Change-Id: I8165fcd98e11b9155640559a36ae90a38f63c0dd
Closes-Bug: #1814177
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-02-11 15:42:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'nova/tests/functional/notification_sample_tests/test_instance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/03e4e3ce1357123f9f53a3901a17a64f160653a4', 'message': 'Fix race in test_volume_swap_server_with_error

Change I03c8e8225e51fd80580772752c0b292987e34218 added
another notification to the list checked in
test_volume_swap_server_with_error and then change
Id587967ea4f9980c292492e2f659bf55fb037b28 relied on
checking the last notification in the list (compute.exception)
but per the note in the test, that last exception can
race to show up by the time we check the size of the
notification list which can result in an IndexError.

This change fixes the race by just waiting for the
compute.exception notification rather than the racy
_wait_until_swap_volume_error which depended on the
cinder fixture swap_error variable (which is removed
in this change).

Change-Id: I8165fcd98e11b9155640559a36ae90a38f63c0dd
Closes-Bug: #1814177
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race in test_volume_swap_server_with_error

Change I03c8e8225e51fd80580772752c0b292987e34218 added
another notification to the list checked in
test_volume_swap_server_with_error and then change
Id587967ea4f9980c292492e2f659bf55fb037b28 relied on
checking the last notification in the list (compute.exception)
but per the note in the test, that last exception can
race to show up by the time we check the size of the
notification list which can result in an IndexError.

This change fixes the race by just waiting for the
compute.exception notification rather than the racy
_wait_until_swap_volume_error which depended on the
cinder fixture swap_error variable (which is removed
in this change).

Change-Id: I8165fcd98e11b9155640559a36ae90a38f63c0dd
Closes-Bug: #1814177
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/634334/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Eight versioned notifications are generated. We only rely on the # first seven because _wait_until_swap_volume_error will return True # Per the note above, we could race to get the compute.exception # notification so we need to wait for it here. for x in range(10): if len(fake_notifier.VERSIONED_NOTIFICATIONS) == 8: break time.sleep(0.5) else: self.fail('Timed out waiting for final versioned notification. ' 'Got: %s' % fake_notifier.VERSIONED_NOTIFICATIONS)
deleted_lines: # Seven versioned notifications are generated. We only rely on the # first six because _wait_until_swap_volume_error will return True

subject: Remove port allocation during detach
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-04 16:49:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7ef51be61f85f66938fdb0627827c3bade749e72', 'message': 'Remove port allocation during detach

If the port has resource allocation in placement then during inteface

commit_message:
Remove port allocation during detach

If the port has resource allocation in placement then during interface
detach nova needs to update the instance allocation in placement,
removing the resources from it that was there because of the port that
is being detached.

blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

Change-Id: I0fb35036e77e9abe141fe8831b4c23d02e567b96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/622421/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Mocking detach is a hack but the fake virt driver does not allow # detaching interfaces that are added during the boot. Also the fake virt # driver is not easy to fix to allow it. In the other hand ports with # bandwidth request cannot be attached after the server is booted. @mock.patch('nova.virt.fake.SmallFakeDriver.detach_interface') def test_interface_detach_with_port_with_bandwidth_request( self, mock_detach): # create a server server = self._create_server( flavor=self.flavor, networks=[{'port': self.neutron.port_with_resource_request['id']}]) self._wait_for_state_change(self.admin_api, server, 'ACTIVE') self.api.detach_interface( server['id'], self.neutron.port_with_resource_request['id']) # TODO(gibi): wait for port unbind instead of sleep time.sleep(1) updated_port = self.neutron.show_port( self.neutron.port_with_resource_request['id'])['port'] allocations = self.placement_api.get( '/allocations/%s' % server['id']).body['allocations'] # We expect that the port related resource allocations are removed self.assertEqual(1, len(allocations)) compute_allocations = allocations[self.compute1_rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertEqual(self._resources_from_flavor(self.flavor), compute_allocations) # We expect that the allocation is removed from the port too binding_profile = updated_port['binding:profile'] self.assertNotIn('allocation', binding_profile)

subject: Change process name of neutron-server to match worker role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-14 18:16:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3ee2889bf6961443bff2d68b251d71542eadf6a4', 'message': 'Change process name of neutron-server to match worker role

We spawn a lot of neutron-servers, on all but the smallest systems.
It's often hard to tell which are busy/overloaded or spinning.
Add an option to set the process names to their role. This should
likely be off by default, so we don't break any existing scripting,
but I'm leaving it on for the first pass of CI, just in case.

Note: DO NOT MERGE until the default is flipped off, unless everyone
wants it on.

Sample output:
$ ps xw | grep neutron-server
 1126 pts/2    S+     0:00 grep --color=auto neutron-server
25355 ?        Ss     0:26 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/neutron-server --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
25368 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25369 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25370 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25371 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25372 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: rpc worker
25373 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: rpc worker
25374 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: services worker

The "normal" looking ps output is the main parent.

This will require a global-requirements change. Including those changes
here temporarily, to see if the tests will run.

Change-Id: I0e664a5f8e792d85b8f5483fb8c6f1cd59a677cd

commit_message:
Change process name of neutron-server to match worker role

We spawn a lot of neutron-servers, on all but the smallest systems.
It's often hard to tell which are busy/overloaded or spinning.
Add an option to set the process names to their role.

This has a small chance of breaking existing scripting, depending
how they're parsing ps output.

Sample output:
$ ps xw | grep neutron-server
 1126 pts/2    S+     0:00 grep --color=auto neutron-server
25355 ?        Ss     0:26 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/neutron-server \
  --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf \
  --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
25368 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25369 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25370 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25371 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25372 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: rpc worker
25373 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: rpc worker
25374 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: services worker

The "normal" looking ps output is the main parent.

Partial-Bug: #1816485

commit_message:
Amp driver support sni option to send the hostname to backend

If the Tls option of Pool is True, we default configure a sni option in
the associated members configuration, which is "sni ssl_fc_sni".

Story: 2003858
Task: 26684

commit_message:
Update requests to 2.20.1 for CVE-2018-18074

Given that the OpenStack deployment projects, and many operators
make use of upper-constraints for building OpenStack from source,
it would be prudent to update the requests library to the release
which takes care of this vulnerability.

The version change only includes bug fixes in the changelog, but
notably removes official support for python 2.6. If OpenStack
still considers python 2.6 as officially supported for stable/rocky,
then we'd have to advise packagers, deployment projects and operators
to implement alternative strategies based on the version of python
they consider supported for their implementations.

Change-Id: Ia9a9d500a5d2df92321f4201f291401787fb8914
Changelog: http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/community/updates/#release-and-version-history
CVE: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-18074
Story: 2004979

commit_message:
Add remove_resources_from_instance_allocation to report client

The subsequent patch I0fb35036e77e9abe141fe8831b4c23d02e567b96 will need
to modify the existing instance allocation by removing a set of resources.
This patch adds the necessary report client code to be able to do that.

Change-Id: I66d69327d3361825ca0b44b46744b97ea3069eb1
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/53/639653/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def remove_resources_from_instance_allocation( self, context, consumer_uuid, resources): """Removes certain resources from the current allocation of the consumer. :param context: the request context :param consumer_uuid: the uuid of the consumer to update :param resources: a dict of resources. E.g.: { <rp_uuid>: { <resource class>: amount <other resource class>: amount } <other_ rp_uuid_1>: { <other resource class>: amount } } :raises AllocationUpdateFailed: if the requested resource cannot be removed from the current allocation (e.g. rp is missing from the allocation) or there was multiple generation conflict and we run out of retires. :raises ConsumerAllocationRetrievalFailed: If the current allocation cannot be read from placement. :raises: keystoneauth1.exceptions.base.ClientException on failure to communicate with the placement API """ # NOTE(gibi): It is just a small wrapper to raise instead of return # if we run out of retries. if not self._remove_resources_from_instance_allocation( context, consumer_uuid, resources): error_reason = ("Cannot remove resources %s from the allocation " "due to multiple subsequent generation conflict " "in placement.") raise exception.AllocationUpdateFailed( consumer_uuid=consumer_uuid, error=error_reason % resources) @retries def _remove_resources_from_instance_allocation( self, context, consumer_uuid, resources): if not resources: # Nothing to remove so do not query or update allocation in # placement. # The True value is only here because the retry decorator returns # False when runs out of retries. It would be nicer to raise in # that case too. return True current_allocs = self.get_allocs_for_consumer(context, consumer_uuid) error_reason = "Cannot remove resources %s from allocation %s. %s" if not current_allocs['allocations']: raise exception.AllocationUpdateFailed( consumer_uuid=consumer_uuid, error=error_reason % ( resources, current_allocs, 'The allocation is empty.')) try: for rp_uuid, resources_to_remove in resources.items(): allocation_on_rp = current_allocs['allocations'][rp_uuid] for rc, value in resources_to_remove.items(): allocation_on_rp['resources'][rc] -= value if allocation_on_rp['resources'][rc] < 0: raise exception.AllocationUpdateFailed( consumer_uuid=consumer_uuid, error=error_reason % ( resources, current_allocs, 'There is not enough inventory left on %s RP ' 'to remove %d amount of %s resources.' % ( rp_uuid, value, rc))) if allocation_on_rp['resources'][rc] == 0: # if no allocation left for this rc then remove it # from the allocation del allocation_on_rp['resources'][rc] except KeyError as e: # rp_uuid is missing from the allocation or resource class is # missing from the allocation raise exception.AllocationUpdateFailed( consumer_uuid=consumer_uuid, error=error_reason % ( resources, current_allocs, 'Key %s is missing from the allocation.' % e)) # we have to remove the rps from the allocation that has no resources # any more current_allocs['allocations'] = { rp_uuid: alloc for rp_uuid, alloc in current_allocs['allocations'].items() if alloc['resources']} r = self._put_allocations( context, consumer_uuid, current_allocs) if r.status_code != 204: err = r.json()['errors'][0] if err['code'] == 'placement.concurrent_update': reason = ('another process changed the resource providers or ' 'the consumer involved in our attempt to update ' 'allocations for consumer %s so we cannot remove ' 'resources %s from the current allocation %s' % (consumer_uuid, resources, current_allocs)) # NOTE(gibi): automatic retry is meaningful if we can still # remove the resources from the updated allocations. Retry # works here as this function (re)query the allocations. raise Retry( 'remove_resources_from_instance_allocation', reason) # It is only here because the retry decorator returns False when runs # out of retries. It would be nicer to raise in that case too. return True

commit_message:
fix up numa-topology live migration hypervisor check

It turns out that even when KVM is supported by qemu the libvirt
driver will report the hypervisor type as "QEMU".  So we need to
fix up the hypervisor type check in the live migration code that
checks whether the instance has a NUMA topology.

Closes-Bug: #1818092
Change-Id: I5127227a1e3d76dd413a820b048547ba578aff6b
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Silence syncronize on post to avoid console spam

Makes rsync quiet on console for successes but always dumps its
output to rsync-result.json file.

Improves UX by making easier to read the log and to find the real
error message while still allowing the user to dig for extra
information if needed.

Change-Id: I506ef82e9ece4bcad6a4e3e95a8bed36c005d990
Relates-To: I364e4cc7607e94e82420e108ac03520dd4e62eab

- prints list of supported distros when it fails

Newer version succesfully executes succesfully on Debian/MacOS/FreeBSD.

Change-Id: Ib36a0f7de64d158b801d48356536569560f83acf

commit_message:
Made quickstart.sh more portable

- Corrects rpm command dependency when checking for sudo.

- Applies selinux workaround only for selinux enabled systems,
  previously it was failing on such systems.

- avoid failure to load ansible_ssh_env.sh when run with -n

- allow execution from non supported systems if user defines
  QS_SUPPORTED_DISTRO_CHECK (or supported_disto_check in ansible)
  to false.

- includes Fedora in list of supported distros

- prints list of supported distros when it fails

Newer version succesfully executes on Fedora/Debian/MacOS/FreeBSD.

Change-Id: Ib36a0f7de64d158b801d48356536569560f83acf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/80/627880/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: which sudo >/dev/null || $(package_manager) install -y sudo if [[ -f /etc/selinux/config ]]; then $(python_cmd) -c "import selinux" 2>/dev/null || copy_selinux_to_venv fiif [ -f $OOOQ_DIR/ansible_ssh_env.sh ]; then source $OOOQ_DIR/ansible_ssh_env.sh fi
deleted_lines: rpm -q sudo || $(package_manager) install -y sudo $(python_cmd) -c "import selinux" 2>/dev/null || copy_selinux_to_venvsource $OOOQ_DIR/ansible_ssh_env.sh

commit_message:
Adjust default of ``ram-allocation-ratio`` configuration option

In modern hyper-converged architectures the upstream default of
1.5 does not really fit.

Set to 0.98 to give some headroom on the compute nodes and add
a note about the potential need to adjust this value further.

Change-Id: I64e3379686128dd7f222bdfae133a6c90e8f3ef0
Closes-Bug: #1818234
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-cloud-controller refs/changes/41/640541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default: 0.98 . NOTE: When in a hyper-converged architecture, make sure to make enough room for infrastructure services running on your compute hosts by adjusting this value.

commit_message:
Update docs landing page to follow guideline

During the rocky cycle, there was a docs-spec approved [0] with the
goal of having a recommended consistent documentation landing page
for all projects.

This updates our docs landing page to follow the structure described
in that recommendation.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/rocky/front-page-template.html

Change-Id: Ie2d2a2c06ef0ffe32a80eac85313ab57020af5ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/33/616433/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =================================================== Openstack Shared Filesystems (manila) documentation =================================================== What is Manila? --------------- Manila is the OpenStack Shared Filesystems service for providing Shared Filesystems as a service. Some of the goals of Manila are to be/have:For end users ------------- As an end user of Manila, you'll use Manila to create a remote file system with either tools or the API directly. `python-manilaclient <https://docs.openstack.org/python-manilaclient/latest/>`_, or by directly using the `REST API <https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/>`_. Tools for using Manila ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * `Manila Client <https://docs.openstack.org/python-manilaclient/latest/user/shell.html>`_: The **openstack** CLI is recommended, but there are some advanced features and administrative commands that are not yet available there. For CLI access to these commands, the **manila** CLI can be used instead. Using the Manila API ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ All features of Manila are exposed via a REST API that can be used to build more complicated logic or automation with Manila. This can be consumed directly or via various SDKs. The following resources can help you get started consuming the API directly. * `Manila API <https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/>`_ * :doc:`Manila microversion history </contributor/api_microversion_history>` For operators ------------- This section has details for deploying and maintaining Manila services.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Manila can be configured standalone using the configuration setting ``auth_strategy = noauth``, but in most cases you will want to at least have the `Keystone <https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/install/>`_ Identity service and other `OpenStack services <https://docs.openstack.org/latest/install/>`_ installed.Administrating Docs ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Contents:Reference ~~~~~~~~~ Contents cli/index Additional resources ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * `Manila release notes <https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/manila/>`_ Additional reference ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Contents:Additional reference ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Contents:
deleted_lines: Welcome to Manila's developer documentation! ============================================ Manila is an OpenStack project to provide "Shared Filesystems as a service".This documentation is generated by the Sphinx toolkit and lives in the source tree. Additional draft and project documentation on Manila and other components of OpenStack can be found on the `OpenStack wiki`_. Cloud administrators, refer to `docs.openstack.org`_. .. _`OpenStack wiki`: https://wiki.openstack.org .. _`docs.openstack.org`: https://docs.openstack.org =================Admin Docs ==========Contributor/Developer Docs ========================== .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 1 contributor/index Command Line Interface Documentation ==================================== .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 1 cli/index Configuration Reference ======================= Other Reference ===============User Documentaton ================= .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 1 user/index Indices and tables ==================

commit_message:
Normalize the image pull policy.

It should be "IfNotPresent","Always" and "Never" whose first letter is
capital. While in some template files of this project, it was wrote like
"ifnotpresent" which is not supported by the latest version of
Kubernetes.

Change-Id: Ice99f328a22e874ef7cabd8636a1581fef84056b
Closes-Bug:#1809350

added_lines: imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent

subject: Fix L3 agent scheduler tests in multinode environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-26 11:52:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/9bfa6b3863a197073ee43241a0c3d0072cac8bb6', 'message': 'Fix L3 agent scheduler tests in multinode environments

Router in test_l3_agent_scheduler module will now always be
created as HA router. This will allow to always schedule it to one
of available L3 agents without raising Conflict exception in
Neutron.
Such Conflict can be returned from neutron server if nonHA router
already scheduled to one L3 agent is tried to be added manually
to other L3 agent.

Change-Id: Ia45ac3528385dce7f25c557e682eaf1923393f94
Closes-Bug: #1817696
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-02-27 10:25:48.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/admin/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/d5ea81213622b7749a729310c468220dabb4b9f1', 'message': 'Fix L3 agent scheduler tests in multinode environments

which it was hosted and then add it to one of agents again.

commit_message:
Fix L3 agent scheduler tests in multinode environments

Test will now first try to remove router from all agents on
which it was hosted and then add it to one of agents again.

Change-Id: Ia45ac3528385dce7f25c557e682eaf1923393f94
Closes-Bug: #1817696

added_lines: @classmethod def create_router(cls, router_name=None, admin_state_up=False, external_network_id=None, enable_snat=None, **kwargs): router_name = router_name or data_utils.rand_name( cls.__name__ + "-router") ext_gw_info = {} if external_network_id: ext_gw_info['network_id'] = external_network_id if enable_snat is not None: ext_gw_info['enable_snat'] = enable_snat body = cls.admin_routers_client.create_router( name=router_name, external_gateway_info=ext_gw_info, admin_state_up=admin_state_up, **kwargs) router = body['router'] cls.addClassResourceCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, cls.delete_router, router) return router

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-12 18:28:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/20a46ece5701c9798a5e0df12c944237cb1ece3e', 'message': 'RT: improve logging in _update_usage_from_migration

While working on some code which performs a resize_claim

with how prep_resize works and the bowels of the

commit_message:
RT: improve logging in _update_usage_from_migration

While working on some code which performs a resize_claim
I was finding that the actual new_flavor usage was not being
tracked on the destination host. It was a coding mistake
because I had not set instance.new_flavor before calling
resize_claim but that is extremely tightly coupled behavior
with how prep_resize works and the bowels of the
_update_usage_from_migration code works. This change simply
improves logging in the _update_usage_from_migration method
for debugging and updates the resize_claim docstring to
indicate the coupled nature of instance.new_flavor when calling
that method.

Change-Id: Ieb539c9a0cfbac743c579a1633234537a8e3e3ee

revisions:

When _find_related_obj() raises a RuntimeError, the output
is something like this:

RuntimeError: (u'revises_on_change relationships must have

Should be using a % to print the message correctly.

"}]
commit_message:
Fix _find_related_obj() RuntimeError output

When _find_related_obj() raises a RuntimeError, the output
is something like this:

RuntimeError: (u'revises_on_change relationships must have
                 load_on_pending set to True to bump parent
                 revisions on create: %s', 'networks')

Should be using a % to print the message correctly.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I90f9ef7c6de00ae388adb303c0e22a2a6c112e88

subject: Do not print router resize messages when not resizing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-28 16:58:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/22369ba7fe75e73c3451a2e826dee331117787f3', 'message': "Do not print router resize messages when not resizing

I noticed in the functional logs that the l3-agent is constantly
logging this message, even when just adding or removing a single
router:

  Resizing router processing queue green pool size to: 8

It's misleading as the pool is not being resized, it's still 8,
so let's only log when we're actually changing the pool size.

Change-Id: I5dc42fa4b4c1964b7d027681b61550cd82e83234
"}]
commit_message:
Do not print router resize messages when not resizing

I noticed in the functional logs that the l3-agent is constantly
logging this message, even when just adding or removing a single
router:

  Resizing router processing queue green pool size to: 8

It's misleading as the pool is not being resized, it's still 8,
so let's only log when we're actually changing the pool size.

Change-Id: I5dc42fa4b4c1964b7d027681b61550cd82e83234

commit_message:
Add py3/f28 support to tripleo-container-build-base

Enable Fedora 28 and Python3 support on tripleo-buildcontainers
playbook and on tripleo-repos role.

Centos-7 job would run upstream and its fedora-28 counterpart would
be run on RDO and be non voting

Uses: https://review.openstack.org/637212
User-Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/650
Change-Id: Ie46d0d7fa7c41427bb44bcfad5cf59af745ac627
Co-Authored-By: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Reproducer script: run only on job started by zuul

The reproducer script is assuming a job was started by zuul. In some instances
we are still running jobs from platform different than zuul like ci.centos. In
those instances the log collection fails because the reproducer script creation
misses a lot of files
This patch includes that role only under the condition that zuul variable is
defined.

Change-Id: I01ec134f85943a8332832bdc6caf138d978c1c37

conf: Call out where pci.alias should be set

We could probably do with a more concrete way to specify what services
use a given configuration value, but this is a start.

commit_message:
conf: Deprecate 'disable_libvirt_livesnapshot' option

This was added to handle gate issues seen with libvirt 1.2.2. We haven't
supported that version of libvirt for some time and we don't enable this
in the gate anymore. Deprecate it and remove unnecessary references to
it from tests and the support FAQ document.

Change-Id: Ie3fa537a42d208a35467f03bd2110c2976927477
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/626932/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | The ``[workarounds] disable_libvirt_livesnapshot`` configuration option has been removed. Nova has defaulted to live snapshots since Queens (17.0.0) and the previous issues seen with this feature were reported against a version of libvirt (1.2.2) that is no longer supported by nova.

commit_message:
Pool support sni cert for backend re-encryption

Add 1 fields like Listener does, which is 'tls_container_ref', this
field is introduced into Pool for storage the pool client certificate to
the backend servers, when the traffic willing to bring a cert to the
servers and check for tls connection.

Story: 2003859
Task: 26685
Change-Id: I29b7c7116e6087c942179ed9efdead494ef277a3

added_lines: ca_tls_certificate_id = pool_dict.pop( 'ca_tls_certificate_id', None) crl_container_ref = pool_dict.pop('crl_container_ref', None) if ca_tls_certificate_id: # TODO client_cert_auth_option is None as default, # but required if the following TLS enabled ca_tls_dict = { 'pool_id': db_pool.id, 'tls_container_id': ca_tls_certificate_id, 'client_cert_auth_option': consts.TYPE_NONE, 'crl_container_id': crl_container_ref} self.certification.create(session, **ca_tls_dict) pool_id=None, **model_kwargs): if not (listener_id or pool_id and tls_container_id): elif pool_id: session.query(self.model_class).filter_by( pool_id=pool_id).update(model_kwargs)

commit_message:
Add oslo.privsep to config-generator list

We recently exposed the privsep opts for config generator use, so
projects that depend on oslo.privsep should include them in their
sample configs.

Change-Id: I01606fc921d7ca2e581ac987f6b8d331631278e2

commit_message:
Make tempest-multinode-full job for stable branch

tempest-multinode-full should be available to run on
all stable branch not just master. All the devstack
changes are backported already.

tempest-multinode-full will use Bionic node from
stein onwards and xenial for all other stable branches.

Change-Id: I94f66028df58a69aa7c26e8a03428bf48596d25c

Manually set Namespace for Sonobuoy's config.json.

Sonobuoy's bug forcing heptio-sonobuoy namespace [1] usage only does not
impact this Helm chart because the config.json is directly controlled
by the `values.yaml` and not Sonobuoy's CLI.

Now multiple instances of this chart may exist at once by specifying
unique namespaces at helm install time.

[1] https://github.com/heptio/sonobuoy/issues/420

Change-Id: I6d4ecfb812a4312af13abf1e265de495e27967f9
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2019-02-12 17:22:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-addons/commit/b4c7be1f4b4d02af7adfc426f6c2ba8c563e38a6', 'message': "Sonobuoy: allow multiple simultaneous chart installations

Manually set Namespace for Sonobuoy's config.json.

Sonobuoy's bug forcing heptio-sonobuoy namespace [1] usage only does not
impact this Helm chart because the config.json is directly controlled
by the `values.yaml` and not Sonobuoy's CLI.

Now multiple instances of this chart may exist at once by specifying
unique namespaces at helm install time.

Modify Sonobuoy test script to install two instances of Sonobuoy Helm
chart. Also install readonly serviceaccount to verify it will work with
more than one instance simultaneously.

commit_message:
Sonobuoy: allow multiple simultaneous chart installations

Manually set Namespace for Sonobuoy's config.json.

Sonobuoy's bug forcing heptio-sonobuoy namespace [1] usage only does not
impact this Helm chart because the config.json is directly controlled
by the `values.yaml` and not Sonobuoy's CLI.

Now multiple instances of this chart may exist at once by specifying
unique namespaces at helm install time.

Modify Sonobuoy test script to install two instances of Sonobuoy Helm
chart. Also install readonly serviceaccount to verify it will work with
more than one instance simultaneously.

[1] https://github.com/heptio/sonobuoy/issues/420

Change-Id: I6d4ecfb812a4312af13abf1e265de495e27967f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-addons refs/changes/67/636167/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
