commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I380c7b2010248a257612ad707a69b433054d7a4a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/71/606671/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

Add more complex functional test scenarios

added_lines: CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT = 'CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT' CUSTOM_PHYSNET_3 = 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET_3' self.flavor_with_group_policy = self.api.get_flavors()[1] self.admin_api.post_extra_spec( self.flavor_with_group_policy['id'], {'extra_specs': {'group_policy': 'isolate'}}) agent_rp_req = { "name": "SRIOV agent on host1", "uuid": uuids.sriov_agent_rp_uuid, "parent_provider_uuid": compute_rp_uuid } self.placement_api.post('/resource_providers', body=agent_rp_req, version='1.20') sriov_pf_req = { "name": "SRIOV PF1 on host1", "uuid": uuids.sriov_pf1_rp_uuid, "parent_provider_uuid": uuids.sriov_agent_rp_uuid } self.placement_api.post('/resource_providers', body=sriov_pf_req, version='1.20') self._set_provider_inventories( uuids.sriov_pf1_rp_uuid, {"inventories": { rc_fields.ResourceClass.NET_BW_INGRESS: {"total": 100000}, rc_fields.ResourceClass.NET_BW_EGRESS: {"total": 100000}, }}) self.placement_api.put( '/traits/' + self.CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT, version='1.20') self.placement_api.put( '/traits/' + self.CUSTOM_PHYSNET_3, version='1.20') self._set_provider_traits( uuids.sriov_pf1_rp_uuid, {"traits": [self.CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT, self.CUSTOM_PHYSNET_3]}) def _create_server(self, flavor, networks): flavor_id=flavor['id'], networks=networks) server = self._create_server(flavor=self.flavor, networks=[{'port': port['id']}]) def test_boot_server_with_two_ports_having_resource_request(self): ovs_port = self.neutron.port_with_resource_request sriov_port = self.neutron.port_with_sriov_resource_request server = self._create_server(flavor=self.flavor_with_group_policy, networks=[{'port': ovs_port['id']}, {'port': sriov_port['id']}]) # Failed to allocate the network(s), not rescheduling. # ValueError: No matching allocation found for resource request # {'NET_BANDWIDTH_INGRESS_KILOBITS_PER_SECOND': 10000, # 'NET_BANDWIDTH_EGRESS_KILOBITS_PER_SECOND': 10000} # in allocations # {u'42f305c5-7d8d-4b12-8395-6fe8462c8e89': {u'generation': 3, u'resources': {u'NET_BANDWIDTH_INGRESS_KILOBITS_PER_SECOND': 9000, u'NET_BANDWIDTH_EGRESS_KILOBITS_PER_SECOND': 9000}}, # u'c5accb5f-12d0-4057-ab1f-35e0f0995e1e': {u'generation': 2, u'resources': {u'MEMORY_MB': 2048, u'VCPU': 1, u'DISK_GB': 20}}, # u'224749dc-01df-4c20-91a3-39d18c9ba27e': {u'generation': 3, u'resources': {u'NET_BANDWIDTH_INGRESS_KILOBITS_PER_SECOND': 1000, u'NET_BANDWIDTH_EGRESS_KILOBITS_PER_SECOND': 1000}}} server = self._wait_for_state_change(self.admin_api, server, 'ACTIVE') ovs_port = self.neutron.show_port(ovs_port['id'])['port'] sriov_port = self.neutron.show_port(sriov_port['id'])['port'] allocations = self.placement_api.get( '/allocations/%s' % server['id']).body['allocations'] # We expect one set of allocations for the compute resources on the # compute rp and one set for the networking resources on the ovs bridge # rp and on on the sriov PF rp. self.assertEqual(3, len(allocations)) compute_allocations = allocations[self.compute1_rp_uuid]['resources'] ovs_allocations = allocations[ uuids.ovs_bridge_rp_uuid]['resources'] sriov_allocations = allocations[ uuids.sriov_pf1_rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor, compute_allocations) self.assertPortMatchesAllocation(ovs_port, ovs_allocations) self.assertPortMatchesAllocation(sriov_port, sriov_allocations)

commit_message:
PowerMax driver - rebranding VMAX to PowerMax

PowerMax is to replace VMAX in release notes, online documentation,
directory structure and driver name.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620659/

commit_message:
Use config-table for dynamic config documentation

A lot of our config option reference documentation was out of date, with
deprecated and removed options and changed defaults. This changes the
"Additional options" configuration reference to use the config-table
directive so the published docs stay in sync with changes in the code.

Closes-bug: #1814910

Change-Id: Ib891435dc69eb795ea6d4d0fb6626259e95cf27f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ignore novajoin tests in job that don't support it

After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639323/ we want to run
novajoin tests only in job that support it like featureset 039.
Change-Id: Iac1e0f535db3cc2532048749537c2829eac0cd6b
